section: This Services Agreement (this "Agreement") is entered into on October 1, 2019 and is made effective as of November 1, 2019 (the "Effective Date")
explanation: The agreement states it is entered into on October 1, 2019, but made effective as of November 1, 2019. This creates ambiguity because it's unclear if any actions or obligations are intended to apply between these dates, and if so, what those might be. The contract should specify the rights and responsibilities during that interim period.

section: This Agreement be deemed effective as of the Effective Date, Agreement and shall terminate on December 31, 2020, unless terminated earlier in accordance with Section 3.2.
explanation: The sentence is structurally flawed and does not make sense. The phrase 'This Agreement be deemed effective as of the Effective Date, Agreement' is grammatically incorrect and unclear. It should state clearly when the agreement becomes effective.

section: Recipient shall own all rights, title, and interest in any invention, technique, process, device, discovery, improvement, or know-how made by Provider which results from the Services.
explanation: This is very broad. It may not be enforceable depending on the type of invention and state law. If the provider creates something completely independent of the services, this clause is overly broad.
